name: HYATT house Cypress/Anaheim

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took off a star because, and your experience may differ, the hallway smelled bad...some inconsiderate numbskull brought in some really stinky food.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Conveniently Located

reviews.text: But, again, this may have been a mere temporary setback. The rooms here are BIG, comfortable, and clean. Check-in was a breeze. The TV situation was a bit bizarre, as one was a modern flat screen and the other was an old tube-type set. But we weren't there to watch TV, we just needed a place to hang out and sleep for a night. This hotel more than exceeded our meager need for slumber. Every room comes with a fridge and microwave...great if you've got leftovers (hopefully not stinky leftovers) from one of the nearby restaurants.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: The location is pretty good...not too far from Disneyland and there are several restaurants near this hotel.
reviews.title: The best secret!!

reviews.text: I've stayed here three times now and will continue to return. Easily the best value in the Cypress area. Good location with many places to eat within walking distance. Very good hot breakfast with fresh fruit. Large comfortable suites with full kitchens available in many of them. The only thing that kept me from giving a perfect score is that some of the fixtures (particularly bathroom) are getting a bit dated and the carpets are pretty worn. NOTE: This hotel is now a Hyatt brand "Summerfield Suites".
reviews.title: Ideal Stay

reviews.text: I have stayed there many times. It is truly the best secret in town!! The rooms are above and beyond what you think youll get, the buffet breakfast is suprisingly awesome! A very conveinent location close to attractions business and beaches. I wish I could live there full time.
reviews.title: Waste of Money for a Hyatt Summerfield Suites Hotel

reviews.text: I have read the few poor reviews below and it seems these guest were under the impression that Woodfin should be comparable to the Ritz Carlton ($400+ per night) or The Grand Wailea in Maui ($600+++ per night). It is not. However, it a great place to stay for business or for that family trip to Disneyland for around $120 per night for a suite and they provide breakfast. Would I recommend it to family and friends, YOU BET!
reviews.title: A Perfect Stay

reviews.text: This is a fairly new facility in a quiet location with great access to all that is Orange County. Woodfin is a hidden gem and while you will find the price average, the rooms, service and staff are not.
reviews.title: Loved it! Clean and Comfortable

reviews.text: If you are looking for a great hotel that offers modern quality accommodations for a valued price, this is it.
reviews.title: Pretty decent for the price, but some room for improvement

reviews.text: I wanted to share my experience in this hotel, It was clean and comfortable. We are having mini visit to Knotts berry farm and Adventure city. I was amazed by this hotel because it was clean and I have two toddlers they love to run around. This hotel suites are great with family with children. The free breakfast buffet are fantastic!! I will go back and stay in this hotel again. Disneyland and Knottsberry farm are really close by. =)
reviews.title: Would stay here again.

reviews.text: But make sure you get the second floor room if you want to have really quiet night. downstair they have bar at night so it's kinda noisy at night.
reviews.title: Best kept secret!

reviews.text: This hotel is fairly close to both Disneyland and Knott's for those who wish to go to these places, And they have a shuttle to/from Disneyland. We stayed here for a family wedding. Stayed with my 2 teens and it was suitable for all. Breakfast was amazing! The pool is the BEST I've seen in a hotel--very warm and comfortable. The room rate was very affordable considering what you get for the price. I am an Orange Co. native living in WA state. We will be staying here from now on every summer when we go to visit family!
reviews.title: Best bargain for the area!

reviews.text: Now the HYATT SUMMERFIELD SUITES: I am the PICKIEST guest when to comes to hotels. Kind of a germophobe. This one was exceptional! Quiet and CLEAN!!! I would even go as far as saying the carpet was clean enough to sleep on and it did not feel icky to walk barefoot. Some hotels are iffy where that is concerned. We had originally reserved a 1 bdrm suite which has full kitchen (normal size frig and stove!), a living room area in which the couch folds to a queen bed and a flat screen for Friday/Saturday night stay. It was only 109.00 (99.00 a nt. if we got a king instead of 2 doubles) a night! We got a courtyard view not an parking lot view on the 3rd floor. A balcony overlooking the courtyard area with a soothing sounding fountain and pool area. The bedroom had 2 double beds, very comfortable, and a small flat screen. We had 2 teenage boys with us and so I asked if a 2 bedroom suite was possible and they simply opened a dividing door to another FULL non suite room that had it's own bathroom and flat screen. It was an extra 30.00 a night but so worth it! The boys could stay up late and play video games and would not distrurb us because the living rm was between the 2 sleeping rooms.
reviews.title: CLEAN, QUIET and a GREAT HOTEL!!!!!

reviews.text: The breakfast! Absolutely the best free breaksfast around! From eggs, sausage and pancakes to oatmeal with toppings to cereal, fruit, toast and yogurt. GREAT coffee, too!
reviews.title: Very poor hotel, not worthy of the Hyatt name

reviews.text: For convenience there is a Chili's right next door and a Wendy's not too far on the same side street. 10 miles from the beach and not too far from Knott's and Disney.
reviews.title: Worth Every Dollar! Great Stay!

reviews.text: The only thing is that some of the cabinets(we don't use them anyway) seemed to need repairs but Hyatt just recently took over the property and all the renovations have not been done yet.
reviews.title: Home away from Home

reviews.text: We live in Cypress but we're having work done on our home so we needed a place to stay for 5 nights that provided the amenities of home. I am so glad we chose this hotel! We had a sutie with 2 double beds and the sofa pulled out into a bed, which was perfect. Our internet was excellent as we used our laptop and my daughter used her Ipod Touch. The morning breakfast buffet was excellent and served different food each day. The room was very clean and quiet and the staff was excellent! We had a great experience and I just found out they have a property in San Diego, which I will use when we take our trip to Sea World. I HIGHLY recommend this hotelto anyone staying in the Cypress/Los Alamitos area.
reviews.title: Perfect for Extended Stay with Kids!

reviews.text: Booked a standard king room (not a suite) to save some money - this was a mistake. The room was okay in size (like a regular hotel room), except that it did NOT have a desk. I had to lay on the bed with my laptop in order to use it - which made doing e-mails and reports quite difficult. The housekeeping staff apparently only has orders to update the bathroom (toilet paper, Kleenex, shampoo) either only on guest request/complaint - or when TP and Kleenex are empty. I had to go down to a public bathroom on 2nd floor and take TP and Kleenex back to my room. There is no USA Today paper (WTF?). Bed/pillows were much to soft for me, so I didn't sleep well (if you like soft beds/pillows, you'll probably be happy).
reviews.title: Not bad (for Cypress...)

reviews.text: Room cleanliness and hotel safety were fine. Breakfast buffet was okay (maybe 2.5-3.0 out of 5.0) - on par with most other comparable hotels. WiFi access was fine with good signal strength.
reviews.title: Great value. Good location and rooms.

reviews.text: This was our first stay here and planned a Disney day and Hollywood tour day for 4 adults and 3 kids. We were pleasantly surprised at the great location this was located - nice, quiet and close to several other amenities. The suites were clean and spacious(we had 2 bedrooms - 1 with 2 queens the other had 1 king, each with their own bathroom - center room was the living area with pullout sofa and kitchen), we noticed a dripping sound from one of the AC units and it was fixed immediately. Breakfast was great - there was enough variety for everyone to find something. However, they did continuously run out of hot food and folks had to stand in line - they need better preparation on that end. Beds - don't expect Hilton comfort beds..on the hard side. But overall we enjoyed our stay and you can't beat the value. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Obviously a bad experience is not the norm

reviews.text: You will read a lot of glowing reviews here, but my experience certainly wasn't a good one. I booked the reservation through Hotwire, which will make me think twice before doing that again in the Cypress/Anaheim area. With a two night reservation through Hotwire, you can't simply walk out and go to another hotel. You are STUCK.
reviews.title: awesome

aka: Hyatt Summerfield Suites Cypress/Anaheim Hotel Cypress
